tool_description: Integrate with VS Code extension for AI-powered code editing

available_commands.description: Send edit instruction to VS Code (default command)
Fetch file contents from VS Code
Verify changes were applied to file
List files currently open in VS Code
Check VS Code extension connection status

tool_usage_examples: {"tool": "coding.edit", "args": ["add three sections to the haunted houses article"]}
tool_usage_guidance: Use edit to send coding instructions to VS Code for AI-powered code changes
Use fetch to retrieve and review current file contents
Use verify to check if specific changes were successfully applied
Use files to see what's currently open in VS Code
Use status to check VS Code extension connection health
Empty command defaults to 'edit' for convenience
File path is optional for edit - extension will use active file if not specified
Requires VS Code with Ollama Code Editor extension running on localhost:3000
proactive_triggers: When user requests code changes or modifications
When debugging or fixing bugs in code
When adding new features to existing code
When refactoring code for better structure
When user mentions specific files by name
When user asks to see or review file contents

metadata.notes: Requires VS Code with Ollama Code Editor extension. Extension runs HTTP server on localhost:3000 by default. Refactored to modern modular architecture.
